fields.title: Goa
fields.about_destination:
The party capital of India with amazing beauty to sooth your mind. 
Enjoy the chirp of birds sitting along the waves touching your feet in this amazing paradise.

fields.about_destination: Lonavala is a district in Maharashtra.

fields.details:
Day 01:

• Departure from Delhi Railway station to Goa. 14th January

Day 02:

• Arrival Madgaon in the evening.

• And Goa is On!

• Transfer from Railway station to the 3* Resort in North Goa.

• Check-in and Room allotment on quad sharing.

• Rest? No! Explore on your own or sit by pool and gossip about friend who cancelled the plan yet again.

• Have your Dinner at the resort. 15th January

Day 03:

• Wake up in the fresh air of Goa, freshen up and have your Breakfast as adventure awaits you.

• Reach Calangute’s famous beach for the water adventure.

• Enjoy Jet Ski in the waves of open sea.

• Get hauled in the middle of the sea atop an inflatable banana boat.

• Enjoy Boat ride with friends.

• Spend some time at the beach and watch sun setting in the waters, yup it is as beautiful as it sounds. • Reach back to resort for Dinner • Have your Dinner in resort.

• After Dinner either go for a walk or rest in your room.

16th January Day 04:

• Wake up and have your Breakfast in the resort.

• And prepare yourself, as a pool party is coming your way!

• In the afternoon enjoy Pool Party, jump in to the pool and dance on the beats with beverages (ya right beverages, wink!).

• Make the party worth remembering.

• Get tired of Dancing and have Dinner in the resort. 17th January

Day 05:

• Wake up with a smile, you are in Goa. Have your Breakfast in the Resort

• Explore Goa on your own now take a Self-drive (at own cost) like most people do and explore.

• Explore South Goa beaches and markets on your own.

• Come back to the Resort in Evening. • Spend time around bonfire and chitchat with friends.

• Nothing beats Live Music around a bonfire and to make this trip unbeatable we do have it.

• Gala time • Have Dinner in the Resort

18th January Day 06:

• Wake up in the morning and have Breakfast in the resort.

• Check-out from the hotel • Transfer to Railway station.

• Back Journey to Home.

Day 07:

• Reach back home in the evening with lots of memories to make that friend jealous who cancelled.

Day 1: ARRIVAL

Transfer to hotel and get freshen up. This is acclimatization day so no other works to do. Dinner and overnight stay. 

Day 2: LEH (SIGHT SEEING) 

After having breakfast proceed towards the market where your Bullet will be waiting for you. Take your rides and explore leh whole day. 

Day 3: LEH – NUBRA 

Breakfast at the hotel. Early Morning Leave Leh for NUBRA VALLEY passing through Horzey & Gangles Village. The road then rises to reach Khardungla (5602 Mts.) the world’s highest Motorable road & enjoy the landscape & the beautiful birds eye view of the Leh town. Halt for a picnic lunch at Khardungla village. Later proceed to Khalsar at Shyok Valley 35 Kms by drive. The road after crossing Khalsar Bridge at Shyok River enters Nubra Valley & then proceed along the Nubra River to arrive in the afternoon at Tegar or Kyegar as local call it. Meals & Overnight stay in tents at Lhari-Mo North Camp at Sumur (Kyegar & Sumur are very close by) OR At Tirith Camp at Tirith. Dinner and overnight at the Camp.

Day 4: NUBRA – PANGONG
Leave early morning after breakfast leave for Pangong Lake through Changla passes 5486 Mtrs. While ascending Changla pass 5486 mtrs enjoy the beautiful panoramic view of the villages below the pass. After crossing the pass halt for picnic lunch at Tsoltak, the summer pastureland of the yaks. Arrive Durbuk and from there a short drive takes you to the western shore of the lake. Dinner & overnight stay at Hotel / Camp in Pangong.

Day 5: PANGONG LAKE – LEH 

Enjoy the landscape in the back drop of the Lake. This famous blue brackish Lake of Pangong is 5-6 Kms wide and over 144 Kms long with half of it running the other side of the “INDO CHINA BORDER”. In the late afternoon drive back to Leh. Dinner & overnight stay in Leh.

DAY 6: LEH – LEH AIRPORT 

Have you breakfast in the morning and we move towards the leh airport to reach back home.

Day 01:
Reach Barshaini which is 10 kms from Manikaran from where the trek will start. En-route amidst by the lush green meadows and mesmerizing beauty of parvati valley and waterfalls. Reach campsite and check-in, enjoy dinner at 3000m height and overnight stay in camps. Enjoy weather and beauty of raw camping and adventure at its best.

Day 02:
Wake up in the morning and go for a dip in natural Jaccuzi, the hot water spring is what Kheerganga is famous for so you cannot miss that, have your breakfast and leave for Barshaini.

Day 03:
Have a visit to the famous holy place Manikaran and experience a born fire night at Kasol.

Day1- Depart at 9 PM from Patiala/Chd.
Day2- Reach Narkanda at 8 AM Camp check-in where breakfast will be served. After breakfast gets ready for the trek to Hatu peak/Dertu. Packed food will be served after trekking, then trek down to camps, relax for some time then enjoy your dinner with Bonfire and some light music.
Overnight stay at camps.
Day3- Pack your bags then proceed to Narkanda, have your breakfast there then we proceed to Shimla, from where you can enjoy your cycling also from Shimla to aHssan valley( 4-5 km cycling ),
then Shimla- sightseeing, then we depart at 10 PM from Shimla.
Day4- Reach back Patiala/Chd at 6 AM.
PLACES OF INTEREST
HATU PEAK (3300m): 8 km from Narkanda, the road is surrounded by pine and spruce trees. On top of the hill, ancient Hatu Mata temple is located. The peak offers a spectacular view of the entire Himalayan ranges, snow clad mountains and in depths are the dense forests, green fields, and apple orchards. Hiking is recommended to reach the peak

KACHERI (1810m): This place is located 0.5 km from Oddi, and 7 km from Narkanda on NH – 22 and famous for ancient Mahamaya Temple.

KOTGARH AND THANEDHAR (1830m): 17 km link road bifurcating from Narkanda takes you to the Himachal’s Horticultural heartland, Kotgarh, and Thanedhar, renown for apple orchards. The famous Stokes Farm is located at Thanedhar. Stokes came to India on a trip and while on a summer visit to Shimla, fell in love with its environments, which included the charming hill folk and settled down in Kotgarh. He started the apple farm which soon became renown with its Red Delicious, Golden Delicious and Royal Delicious,  30 minute applies.

JALLORI PASS (3,550 m): 90 km from Narkanda, passing through the Sutlej Valley and crossing over to Luhri, Ani, Khang through one of the best scenery in the Kullu Valley takes you to Jallori30-minutelevel walk from the Pass takes you to Sarolsar Lake among deep forests. See nature at it’s best.

Day 01-
Departure at 7 PM (fixed departure) in deluxe ac (push back) bus.

Day 02 – Mcleodganj
Hault in the midway for breakfast and proceed forward for Mcleodganj. Reach the hotel and check-in. Rest for sometime and Now proceed for Local Sightseeing like Dalai Lama Palace, Tibetian Institute. Lunch at the streets of mcleodganj. After Lunch Proceed for Local Sightseeing like St. John Church, Dal Lake, Bagsunag Temple. Recommended place around would be the bhagsu waterfall, Shiva cafe or if you’re a Mexican food lover than cafe carpedium on the temple road are the places which you need to explore. Evening free for Shopping. Also you can leave for Dharamshala or Dal lake which is in close proximity to the hotel. Reach back to the hotel and get set go on the dance floor as the Dj setup is waiting for you. Exhaust yourself on the floor and Dinner will be served for you & Overnight stay at the Hotel.

Day 03- Triund
Wake up feel refreshed in the morning air and After Having Breakfast proceed for Triund Trekking. Start from Dharamkot and proceed towards Triund. Lunch will be served at the top. After filling up and wondering around we stay overnight in camp in Triund and bonfire will be lit up. Sit around bonfire and dinner will be served to you. Dinner and overnight stay in Triund at Camp.

Day 04-
We will reach back early morning . Tour Ends With Sweet Memories with team Howdy Highlands.

fields.title: Goa Semester Relaxation
fields.head_description:
Level: Average

Route: Rumsu - Chikka - Balu Ka Ghera - Shia Goru - Chatru - Chandra Taal

Height: 14, 100 ft

The Chandratal Lake Trek with Hampta Pass is a treasure trove for the ardent as well amateur trekkers, holds the charm and allurement like any other treks in the Himalayas. Although a short trek, the scenic landscape exposes trails that meander through alpine forests, huge rock formations, and remarkably rich vegetation.
fields.package_description:
Level: Average

Route:  Rumsu - Chikka - Balu Ka Ghera - Shia Goru - Chatru - Chandra Taal

Height: 14, 100 ft

 

The Chandratal Lake Trek with Hampta Pass is a treasure trove for the ardent as well amateur trekkers, holds the charm and allurement like any other treks in the Himalayas.

Although a short trek, the scenic landscape exposes trails that meander through alpine forests, huge rock formations, and remarkably rich vegetation.

Not only does the Chandratal Lake trekking experience introduces you to the captivating beauty of the
Himalayan meadows, cold desert, flora and fauna of the Lahual and Spiti valley, it also get you close to
the life and spirit amidst the lofty peaks. With easy gradients, climbs and descends, this trek will definitely
satiate all your quench for trekking in the Indian Himalayas.

 

Exclusions:

  • Travel from chandigarh to Naggar
  • Personal Expenses.
  • Camera Charges.
  • Tips / Mineral Water / Beverages.
  • Insurance of any kind.
  • Medical and Evacuation Charges.

fields.title: Leh Ladakh SightSeeing
fields.head_description: Leh, a district in the state of Jammu & Kashmir situated at an altitude of 3500m and is famous for its cold deserted climate. It offers astonishing views for explorers and is a must visit place before you die.

fields.title: Trekking in Mcleodganj Triund
fields.head_description:
McLeod Ganj is a suburb of Dharamshala in Kangra district of Himachal Pradesh, India. It is known as "Little Lhasa" or "Dhasa" because of its large population of Tibetans.
With an amazing view.

fields.title: Goa December Fun
fields.head_description: The best chilling packageGoa is a state in western India with coastlines stretching along the Arabian Sea. Its long history as a Portuguese colony prior to 1961 is evident in its preserved 17th-century churches and the area’s tropical spice plantations. Goa is also known for its beaches, ranging from popular stretches at Baga and Palolem to those in laid-back fishing villages such as Agonda.
fields.package_description: Goa is a state in western India with coastlines stretching along the Arabian Sea. Its long history as a Portuguese colony prior to 1961 is evident in its preserved 17th-century churches and the area’s tropical spice plantations. Goa is also known for its beaches, ranging from popular stretches at Baga and Palolem to those in laid-back fishing villages such as Agonda.

fields.title: Kasol and Kheerganga Trek
fields.head_description: Get ready to experience a mesmerising view in the heart of Parvati Valley and for a thrilling trek to Kheerganga. And be prepared to feel the essence of purity in the heart of Himachal.

fields.title: Howdy Party at Goa
fields.head_description: Howdy Goa Trip Itinerary Goa! India’s answer to Ibiza. From the relics of old Goa to the beaches of Baga and Calangute to flamed flea markets. Here is your complete itinerary for the Youth trip to Goa.

The best goa experience anyone could have and it was wonderful tripping with them.

fields.title: Bungee Jumping Lonavala
fields.short_description: Lonavala is one of the best and safest bungee jumping spots in India. It is also one of the closest spot for of Mumbai and Pune adventure junkies, located exactly halfway between the two.The Bungee jump height is 45 m and to do it you should be minimum 10 years old.
fields.notes_for_activity: Clothing - Please dress according to the weather. Dress in comfortable, casual clothes. Skirts are not recommended! Footwear - Please refrain from wearing boots or anything that may interfere with ankle harnesses otherwise they will have to be removed prior to jumping. Trainers and securely fastened shoes are fine. Glasses / Contact lenses - Unfortunatley glasses and hard contact lenses cannot be worn however soft contact lenses for jumping are allowed.

fields.title: Bungee Jumping Bangalore
fields.short_description:
Bangalore is known for offering memorable non-fixed bungee jumping in India. Proper safety measures are taken by the management for the visitors. Treat your eyes to the amazing sights when your reach your jump spot. It is going to be an amazing experience.

Height of Bungee Jumping: 25 m platform suspended from a 40 m high crane

Minimum Age: 18 years
fields.notes_for_activity: Clothing - Please dress according to the weather. Dress in comfortable, casual clothes. Skirts are not recommended! Footwear - Please refrain from wearing boots or anything that may interfere with ankle harnesses otherwise they will have to be removed prior to jumping. Trainers and securely fastened shoes are fine. Glasses / Contact lenses - Unfortunatley glasses and hard contact lenses cannot be worn however soft contact lenses for jumping are allowed

fields.title: Scuba diving
fields.short_description:
Beginner's Dive
No swimming skills required for this activity.
videos and photographs are included
Scuba diving certificate will be provided
Scuba master accompanies with you in water

Specifications -
Maximum depth of the program is 8m.
Boat trip duration-25 minutes
this is a morning dive.
fields.notes_for_activity: Never drink and dive – Intoxication can put a diver in a compromised position. One being the inability to use common sense, and make rational judgments, especially when it involves safety. Don’t eat a big meal before making your dive – You should wait at least two hours after eating before you make your dive. Diving on a full belly can put you in a dangerous situation. Not only creates the possibility of acquiring cramps, but also possible upchucking in your mouthpiece making it difficult to breathe. Never conceal any serious or chronic medical conditions you know to exist.

fields.title: Parasailing Goa
fields.short_description: The most amazing experience of flying above water and then slowly swiming down.
fields.notes_for_activity: Please Note: Your clothes may get wet. So carry extra pair of clothes for after activity.

fields.title: Synthetic shirt for warmth and sun protection.
Sturdy footwear – sandals with straps (no flip-flops), sneakers, wetsuit boots.
5 Unknown Treks in Himachal Pradesh
fields.head_description: If you've landed here, you're probably looking for a trek to do this summer. We understand it's hard for you to choose out of so many treks! So we've put down the 5 best treks to do this May and June.

fields.title: Adventure Tours In Himachal
fields.head_description: Adventure tours in Himachal Pradesh are for individuals of any age and of differed tastes regarding activities. A large portion of such activities make use of hills in a few or the other route, as...

fields.title: 1. Charang Ghati Pass
fields.description: The trek to this ghati is on the troublesome side yet it’s breathtaking for more than the view it offers. One, it is covered close to its beginning stage Kinnaur, which is encompassed by Tibet on the east, Garhwal on the south, Spiti Valley on the north and Kullu on the west. Second, given the various societies around the area, one can meet Kinnauri clan in transit and drench in their dialect and culture, which is an experience in itself. The base camp for the trek is Reckong Po which is accessible by road from Shimla, Delhi and different areas.

fields.title: 2. Darati Pass Trek
fields.description: A standout amongst the most unexplored treks in Himachal, this one takes you to the Pir Panjal run. It begins from Chamba and associates Churha valley with the Pangi Hills of the Himalayas.The far up to the go is through the Gujjar settlements that can be extremely useful to track your trail up the mountains. The trek begins simple and straightforward yet it turns out to be a significant experience as you draw near to the Darati Pass. This trek is situated in the high height of 4700 m, which makes it extreme however spectacular experience. The snow, solid breezes and even snow fall can be experienced and managed in transit. The drive to Chamba, regardless of which course you take is as troublesome as the trek itself. So go prepared!

fields.title: 3. Pin Parvati Trek
fields.description: Pin Parvati pass isn’t the most unheard area in the trekking circles, not to mention Himachal-particular treks. This pass was first traveled in 1884 to locate a backup way to go to Spiti Valley. The excellence of the trek lies in the enterprise and difficulties it postures while you appreciate the lavish green valley in Kullu and the magnificence of Spiti. The trek connects the Pin valley in Spiti and the Parvati Valley in Kullu, thus giving it the name it has. In transit, you will see thick elevated timberlands, ice sheet peaks, lakes and ofocurse the substantial snowfall gives it a great feeling that will stay scratched in your memory until the end of time.

fields.title: 4. Trek through Pabbar Valley
fields.description: This is a standout amongst the most unexplored treks that is carefully fit for first-timers and novices in the trekking world. The trek interfaces Shimla area to the Kinnaur valley, while you go through the thick forests,high knolls and the snow bound mountains that brings you into the apple plantations of the Sangia valley. It’s an extraordinary trek on the off chance that you jump at the chance to investigate nearby culture while you climb your way up to the mountains.

fields.title: 5. Thachi Valley trek
fields.description: At a height of 3000 m above ocean level, this valley is found near the dazzling national Himalayan Park. It’s a very quiet, untouched and absolutely unique area to consider trekking to. One can achieve the valley and afterward take basic treks to the pinnacles and waterfalls a couple of kms off the valley. You will not discover any lodgings, cabins or restaurants in Thachi however the local individuals will deal with that. As of late, local people have met up to advance their valley and motivate tourists to visit it.

fields.title: 1. Trekking in Himachal Pradesh
fields.description:
Adventure tours in Himachal Pradesh are of various lengths and trouble levels for you to look over according to your desire or ability. The by walking endeavor to Hampta Pass is very prominent and is respected by every one of the individuals who have participated in it.

.Prashar Lake Trek: One of the most beautiful weekend treks in Mandi. … The Prashar Lake trek is fit for individuals of all interest- and expertise levels.

• Hampta Pass Trek: Lying at an elevation of about 3960 meters, Hampta pass acts as a bridge between Kullu valley and Lahaul. While trekking, you will pass through amazing sights like thick forests of walnut, oak and pine trees, water streams and various villages located within the mountains. This trek is ideal for all the nature lovers as they can enjoy the beautiful spectrums of nature and remote culture.

• Pin Parvati Pass Trek: With a maximum altitude of 17450 feet, this is a difficult trek and is recommended for seasoned trekkers.

• Spiti Valley Trek with Homestay: Spiti Valley is among the most remote places in the world to be inhabited and , trekking is an amazing way to explore this barren but beautiful valley! Trekking to some of the highest and marvellous monasteries and staying with the locals in a homestay will make your experience memorable. More about Trekking in Spiti Valley

• Triund trek: A popular trekking destination in Himachal Pradesh, this salubrious hill entices its visitors with all its natural grandeur and appeal. While in Triund, you can easily gape in the astounding Dhauladhar Range on one side and the charismatic Kangra Valley on the other. Triund is at the foot of the Dhauladhar ranges and is at a height of 2,828 m.

fields.title: 2. Skiing in Himachal Pradesh
fields.description:
Skiing is the ultimate sport to take up for making the most of adventure tours in Himachal Pradesh taken in the winter season. Skiing in the state is most famously held in Solang Valley.

• Skiing in Solang Valley: The valley lies at an approximate elevation of 8400 feet above the sea. Board the gondola from its base station, and be transported to a height of around 9000 feet above sea level, to the top of the ski point. From here, there is an uninterrupted drop of over half-a-kilometre, which will make your heart beat faster.

• Season: As it depends on the natural availability of snow, skiing will only be organised in the months of December, January and February.

• Time: The best time to ski is during the height of day, when the sun is at its strongest. This period is ideal for the activity as the heat will keep the snow fluffy, and prevent it from turning into ice.

fields.title: 3. Camping in Himachal Pradesh
fields.description:
There is a horde of beautiful and serene locations if you want to take adventure tours in Himachal Pradesh to camp.Camping in Himachal Pradesh is certainly the best way to reconnect with nature. Discover the true shades of serene yet volatile landscapes by spending a day in the hills camping. Camping is probably the best holiday activity for those who are seeking for an escape from the mundane hustle and bustle of daily life.

 Shimla: The capital of the state is additionally among the principal spots to camp. Its beautiful magnificence, cool climate and tranquil outdoors spots make it a perfect place to invest your energy unobtrusively.

• Dharamsala: While remaining here in tents, make sure to click loads of photographs of the landscape of the territory and of the Dhauladhar Range.

• Shoghi: Located roughly 5700 feet over the ocean, Shoghi is another stunning spot in the state to set up tents. The air sifted and scented by pine trees will keep you ever-new.

• Sangla Valley: The campgrounds here utilize the mountains to sort out energizing engagements like waterway crossing, rappelling and shake climbing.

• Sojha: The town of Sojha has a height of around 8860 feet, and the scene here is totally secured by coniferous trees. Forests of fruits and apples make the place considerably prettier, and activities here incorporate trekking and untamed life spotting.

• Thanedar: The apple capital of the state, Thanedar is honored with rich normal excellence and a cool atmosphere.

Find out about other prevalent choices for Camping in Himachal Pradesh.

fields.title: 4. Paragliding in Himachal Pradesh
fields.description:
Go on dventure tours in Himachal Pradesh in the late spring season to participate in paragliding. The movement is prevalent in the state attributable to its slopes, which are utilized as propelling spots. Paragliding in the state is facilitated in Solang Valley, which has just been portrayed above, and the twin spots of Bir and Billing.

Paragliding in Bir Billing: The flights are propelled into the air from Bir, which has an elevation of around 7800 feet. When the time has come to descend, you will arrive at Billing, which has a height of around 5003 feet above ocean level.

Find out about other prominent choices for Paragliding in Himachal Pradesh.

fields.title: 5. Motorbiking and Road Trips in Himachal Pradesh
fields.description:
A portion of the best adventure tours in Himachal Pradesh take you from Manali along the thin and twisting streets of the mountains to Leh. You will drive through destinations like Sarchu, Gata Loops, Morey Plains, Baralacha La, Khardung La, Nubra Valley, Kargil, Dras, Pangong Tso, Keylong, Tanlang La and Rumtse. The level landscape of Morey Plains will give you a casual driving knowledge while the clasp curves of Gata Loops will send chills down your spine.

• Delhi to Spiti Motorbike Expedition through Manali: Nothing can be more daring than taking a 11 days’ bicycle excursion to India’s a standout amongst the most unexplored and strange goals! The scenes of Spiti, the consistently changing shades of Chandratal Lake, 1000 years of age religious communities, and captivating Himalayan Peaks will blow your mind!

• Motorbike Expedition from Manali to Ladakh: Escape to the heaven and burn through 15 days in the midst of the Himalayas! This bicycle excursion will offer you the ideal mix of infertile excellence and enterprise. From remote towns of Himachal Pradesh to the Land of High Altitude Passes, investigate the charming valleys on your fantasy bicycle trip!

A drive through the streets in Himachal Pradesh will get you nearer to the crude magnificence in the midst of mountains. Driving through the Gata Loops of Manali-Leh Highway will be a standout amongst the most exciting encounters of your life. Ride on the Hindustan-Tibet Highway and investigate the Spiti Valley and its charming scenes.

fields.title: Hatu Peak, Narkhanda
fields.property_description:
We bring in the most exquisite stays in India in the very heart of nature. Be away from all the daily bustles and hustles in life and enjoy a peaceful stay at our Hideout. 

Find many more adventures and activities mentioned, and enjoy a pleasant stay with us.
